item.title: Date formatts
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:6, topic:449263”][quote author=t4 link=topic=552159.msg4045104#msg4045104 date=1342039232]

Calendar now = Calendar.getInstance(); if(now.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY) == 12 && now.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK) == Calendar.SUNDAY) { //reset }

HOUR_OF_DAY returns the hour between the range of 0-24 where as HOUR returns it between the range of 0-12.
DAY_OF_WEEK returns the day between the range of 0-7 (Sunday - Saturday).

this is bad since it doesn’t account for when (i’m assuming rsps) doesn’t log in at that time. polling is also bad, if not worse.

http://www.sauronsoftware.it/projects/cron4j/
use this
[/quote]

If its per user then just compare the log in date to the previous one to determine if its after sunday[/quote]
That is also fine:

long lastLoginEpoch;
Date date = df.parse(lastLoginEpoch);

but cron is far superior and it can be used for other scheduling needs.
